Reviews.Title: Fan NOISE overheating
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: I bought this vaio brand last year and after 4 mths, I got the fan noise problem. It is really heavy noise that it irritates me alot. I am a computer science student who chose Vaio over Mac and I have alot of Sony products with me. But this one is a disaster. I even took the laptop to a Sony tech to have the fan changed, but it did not solve the noise and overheating problem. very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Totally awesome Laptop
Reviews.Author: jaxlit
Reviews.Content: The Sony Vaio E series is totally awesome, from Windows 8 to the back lit keyboard. The 1080 1920 resolution can utilize DVD and Blue Ray alike. Would reccomend it to anyone looking for a reliable laptop with many features.

Reviews.Title: Mid Range Laptop with 17" screen full HD--hard to find these days
Reviews.Author: DWD "DW"
Reviews.Content: So, you want a 17" laptop? Good luck, unless you're willing to go for a gaming unit. It seems that manufacturers are making less mid level 17" laptops in favor of the mass selling 15, 14, and 13" models that so many people think are "cute" or whatever. They also almost always come with shiny Gorilla glass for touch screen purposes, which means unless you're in a cave with no ambient light, you're going to get mad glare on your screen (And I have exactly 0 use for a touch screen on a vertical laptop screen). Try that in a coffee shop where you sit where you can. Sometimes the glare on those glass touch screens is so bad you can't even see your screen. But, hey, that is the future.But, not for me. I wanted an aniti-glare matte finish screen in 17" and full HD (so I can get more information on the screen) with a backlit keyboard. The problem is that that combination is almost nonexistent, unless you step up to a gaming laptop. Those will run, for 17" models, around 1400.00 plus. Also, they are made for gaming and have power needs far beyond what a business user needs, or, because of battery life, wants. That's me.If you want or need a backlit keyboard, which I do and did, a 17" 1080p resolution, good battery life, and all for less than 780.00 USD, then this is your PC, and you better get it fast because this combination is a dying breed.Fan noise? Not mine, unless I use the High Power setting, which cranks the fan up regardless of CPU and GPU temperature. I know, it's strange because the two (fan speed vs GPU/CPU temp) should always be linked, but that's how Win 8 and the Sony BIOS in this machine works (You can get software and hack the fan to run at varying temperature based on CPU and GPU temp, and set the fan speed according to temperature, and that's how it should be anyway. I haven't tried SpeedFan yet, so don't ask. And even if you do, I stopped getting replies to any of my reviews, so nee-ner-nee-ner.). So, to get rid of fan noise, use the Balanced power plan and the fan noise goes away, unless you start laying on the CPU or graphics chip, usually by running video, which includes Youtube stuff and other likewise uses. Then it comes on, but it's not really noisy. And yes, when you aren't using the GPU or CPU, the fan is off. Silent. I will give you this, though, even on balanced or power saver (again, I have no idea why Sony linked the "plan" to the BIOS cooling system), once I start using the CPU and the fan does come on, sometimes I have to reboot to get it to kick off all the way.There is nothing I don't like about this PC. I can't speak to longevity because I'm only been using it for two months. It's fairly rigid and does not feel cheap, especially the keyboard, which is just beautiful to use as the feel is positive and snappy and has a quality rubber coating feel to it. Yes, if you lay on the keys you can see a little keyboard flex, but this is the case with most all laptops, in a manner of degree. The lid flexes a little when I pick it up with one hand, but nothing that would harm the PC or screen itself. And, for a 17", it's really light. If I'm doing non CPU or video intensive work, I can get over 3.5 hours on the battery, and that's with the screen cranked up to 85%.The unit has plenty of power and gobs more for all business related uses, including Photoshop rendering and stuff like that. The video card, or integrated chip set, is, indeed, the weak point of the system. You won't be playing any 3D games on it, so forget about Crysis and other games and heavy video editing. It will run your mind numbing web based arcade like games, for those who like that. That said, it will do most anything else 2D, again, running Photoshop just fine (I don't even use PS any longer, as I have no need for it. I use GIMP when I need something like that, and GIMP runs just fine, no slowdowns or other problems).Great system for:-Business applications-Watching Videos or any sort, including DVDs-Low video power need games (most all web based games are ok, and some lesser power hungry games might be ok).-Any entertainment, such as music etc.-Great if you need lots of screen realestate (I trade stocks so I have 7 Windows open full screen all of the time--no problems here).-You want good battery life with a full HD 17" monitor.

Reviews.Title: Had to return twice.
Reviews.Author: Cynthia A. Mederos
Reviews.Content: When I got the first one, there was a problem with the dvd drive. (Not loading programs, returned). Got the second one and there was a problem with the Battery/charger.. It was plugged in but the battery status said plugged, not charging. The percentage was at 50% and not going up.) decided had enough and returned to Amazon for refund. The laptop has nice qualities but the hardware issues were dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: So glad i chose this
Reviews.Author: L. Alarcon "Kdizzle"
Reviews.Content: Looked for a laptop for several days and finally decided on this Vaio.The laptop is fast, beatiful and not as heavy as i was expecting.Although battery life is a bit in the disappointing side it increases dramatically when selecting power save power profile.Im a techie kind of person and its been a while since i've been wowed by any device. The Vaio Gestures, assist button and the screen all have me in awe. :)Just love it!PS: The keyboard on this puppy is nothing short but stunning

Reviews.Title: Please save your money and time!!!
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: This is laptop has been a headache for me since the day I bought it. I wanted to returned it but they wanted to charge me 15% to do so. This was the biggest mistake of my life. I had to call Sony Customer service which is the worst in the world like a 100 times. It was first with problems with the hardware and then with overheating problems.Today, 16 months later after I bought it. The computer's click bottons on the mouse pad do not work and so dont other sofwares programs on the computer.Please do yourself a favor and do not spend a cent on this computer.

Reviews.Title: pretty good
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: so this is pretty good overall. The only thing i am not overly pleased with is windows 8. As much as I just thought that people were bitching just to bitch about it, however that's not really the case. Windows 8 really does suck every bit as bad as everyone says it does, Outside of that, this laptop is wicked fast with plenty of storage.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Marks
Reviews.Content: I love this laptop it looks so great and even works really fast. The only thing that is touchy if anything is the mouse/keypad it sometimes gets janky and doesn't work but it fixes itself within 2-3 seconds still well worth the buy I can run youtube WoW sony vegas skype and facebook all at the same time with no lag or slow speed and if you did somehow need more speed you can upgrade this computer to and 8gb ram which I plan on doing hope this helps ^_^

Reviews.Title: On time delivery
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was glad to get this product.  It got to me on time.  It was quite clean and crisp for a refurbished product and I liked the rating for the seller.  I'll test the laptop out over the next few weeks and see how the CPU speed stands up.  In the meantime, I enjoyed the transaction and will do business with this seller again.

Reviews.Title: Sony really cut corners on a computer that used to be a supreme product.
Reviews.Author: 03stanger
Reviews.Content: My last Sony I purchased in 2008 was a brilliant product with high grade hardware and no disappointments. This unit has the Vaio name on it but not the level of hardware one would expect for this now less than stellar line. Although they advertise a type N network card internal, It turns out to be a single channel Atheros Qualcomm N card that will not surpass 72Mbps speeds. There is no way to upgrade it and Tech support finally admitted this after three phone calls. The video resolution is not up to snuff. I have also found some other quirky issues with graphics that do not appear on any of my other three computers. It does have a USB 3.0 port but it is on the opposite side of the three USB 2.0 ports. Makes it awkward at times if you have it setup on a stand. The HDMI port does not work as well  as previous versions of the Vaio, you have to turn it on as opposed to the other models which automatically changes the output for you when it senses a device attached to it. Be very careful picking this computer, It is not what Sony usually delivers in their Vaio line!

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!!!
Reviews.Author: Luis E Castillo H "Luis E Castillo H"
Reviews.Content: Excellent product. Everything is perfect. I recommend this seller. Quality and Service. I'm really enjoying my purchase, recommended!!! I love it!. Fast and Great Laptop! Change the memory for 8GB.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: D. Butler
Reviews.Content: It's got Windows 8 on it. Some of it's hardware only works with Windows 8, so no downgrading.Great laptop + Windows 8 = Worthless

Reviews.Title: Love my Vaio
Reviews.Author: Diane
Reviews.Content: It does take a little getting used to. The Sony Vaio was recommended to me by my instructor at school. I purchased it and the rest is history. After I got used to it I absolutely love it!

Reviews.Title: Solid All around computer
Reviews.Author: Michael Defonso "defo"
Reviews.Content: Great screen, great everything.  Only (minor) issue is I'm not a tremendous fan of Windows 8.  Has some hangups with Remote Desktopping, and no Start button...

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: caralisa
Reviews.Content: This Sony laptop is everything I need in a business computer.  I can't think of anything that would make it better.

Reviews.Title: lovely desktop replacement. quick and competent.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: worked great right out of the box. Nice screen. Very satisfied. I could use a few more USB ports,but that's the only (very very minor) drawback.
